comment._content: This is a great idea, i work with young people to help them make documentaries and it's great that there's a place we can find archive to use in their projects.

comment.author: 10564098@N08
comment._content: I think the writing in the photo refers to CIudad Juárez, Chihuahua.

comment.author: 20434435@N07
comment._content: It does, and can only be one of 2 BATTLES, ONE IN 1911 AND ANOTHER IN 1915

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Has to be the 1911 battle, since the Library of Congress has not posted any Bain photos from 1915 yet. At this point (August 2010) the Bain photostream on Flickr is up to February, 1914.

comment._content: Copyright does not last forever, in 1911 was 28 years, were due 1939 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_copyright_law

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Found this picture printed on Evening Bulletin issue may 30, 1911 (The Library of Congress, Cronicling America). That means the photo is related to Juárez siege and shelling during May 8 to 10, 1911, in Madero´s rebelion against Porfirio Diaz rule.
Dr. Roberto Duarte
